Ops

Operations module for pypasswordmanager application.

Imports

crypto: for custom cryptographic functions.

datahelper: for getting data file paths.

Functions

new_password_input(): receives new password from the user.

write_new_password(): write new password to disk.

read_passwords(): get list of decrypted passwords.

display_passwords(): display the decrypted passwords.

delete_password(): delete password from disk.

ops.delete_password(user: str, service: str, decrypted_passwords: list[bytes])

Delete chosen password from disk file.

Iterates through list of decrypted passwords, grab the index of service chosen by the user, then opens password file and, using the readlines() method, stores the passwords in a variable. Then, erases the password by using its index and replacing it with an empty byte and, finally, write the new lines to file using writelines() method.

Parameters:

  • user (str) – username.

  • service (str) – service’s name for the password to be erased.

  • decrypted_passwords (list[bytes]) – decrypted passwords list.

ops.display_passwords(decrypted_passwords: list[bytes])

Display decrypted passwords on screen.

Iterates through the decrypted passwords list, converting the items to strings and adjusting them to look nice.

Parameters:

decrypted_passwords (list[bytes]) – list containing decrypted passwords.

ops.new_password_input() → str

Receive input for a new service-password pair.

Receives input of the new service, then uses a while loop to confirm the password of said service, then returns them as a pair with “:” in the middle.

Returns:

new service-password pair.

Return type:

str

ops.read_passwords(user: str, master_password: str, salt: bytes) → list[bytes]

Read encrypted passwords from disk and return them decrypted.

Opens user’s passwords file in read-binary mode, transforms the lines into a list, iterates through it and decrypts the passwords one by one using fernet_decrypt() from crypto. Then, returns the list of decrypted passwords.

Parameters:

  • user (str) – username.

  • master_password (str) – master password to be used in decryption.

  • salt (bytes) – user’s salt.

Returns:

the list of decrypted passwords.

Return type:

list[bytes]

ops.write_new_password(user: str, service_password: str, master_password: str, salt: bytes)

Write new encrypted service-password pair to disk.

Encodes the service-password pair to UTF-8 so it can be encrypted, then encrypts it using fernet_encrypt() from crypto and finally writes the encrypted password to the user’s password file.

Parameters:

  • user (str) – username.

  • service_password (str) – service-password pair to be encrypted.

  • master_password (str) – master password to be used in encryption.

  • salt (bytes) – user’s salt.
